snippet: The apparent arrest of Professor Zhu Jianrong, possibly on espionage charges, comes as relations between China and Japan have hit their lowest point in decades.
abstract: Zhu Jianrong, Chinese specialist in Sino-Japanese affairs who has been living in Japan, appears to have been detained by Chinese government since late July and is being questioned about his activities; news of detention comes at low point in relations between countries and has sown anxiety among Chinese and Japanese academics living in each other's countries.

byline.contributor: Martin Fackler contributed reporting from Tokyo, and Jonathan Ansfield from California.

lead_paragraph: The apparent arrest of Professor Zhu Jianrong, possibly on espionage charges, comes as relations between China and Japan have hit their lowest point in decades.

headline.main: China Is Said to Be Holding a Professor Based in Japan
headline.print_headline: China Is Said To Be Holding A Professor Based in Japan
